  • Constructor Details

    • JSWindow

      public JSWindow(int rid)

  • Method Details

    • getInventories

      public JSInventory[] getInventories()
      Retrieves an array of inventory windows. For example, there may be two inventories in a table or in a smelter.
      Returns:
      A JSInventory array containing the inventories of the window.

    • pushButton

      public void pushButton(String bname)
      Clicks the button with the specified name in this window.
      Parameters:
      String - bname - The exact name of the button to click.

    • pushButton

      public void pushButton(int pos)
      Clicks the button at the specified position in the order they were created in the window. Useful for crossroads where buttons are stacked vertically.
      Parameters:
      Integer - pos - The position of the button in the window (1-based index).

    • getEntryText

      public String getEntryText(int pos)
      Retrieves the text from the TextEntry at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      Integer - pos - The position of the input field (1-based index).
      Returns:
      A String containing the text from the input field, or an empty String if the field is empty or invalid.

    • setEntryText

      public void setEntryText(String text, int pos)
      Sets the text in the TextEntry at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      String - text - The text to set in the TextEntry.
      Integer - pos - The position of the input field (1-based index).

    • activateEntry

      public void activateEntry(String text, int pos)
      Activates the TextEntry at the specified position. If an empty string is specified, the current text in the input field is sent to the server. [Not entirely sure what this would be useful for tbh. Don't feel like researching.]
      Parameters:
      String - text - The text to send to the server. If an empty string is provided, the current text will be sent instead.
      Integer - pos - The position of the input field (1-based index).

    • getLabelText

      public String getLabelText(int pos)
      Retrieves the text of the label at the specified position in the window (e.g., in a barrel window).
      Parameters:
      Integer - pos - The position of the label in the window (1-based index).
      Returns:
      A String containing the text of the label, or an empty String if the label is not found.

    • getMeterValue

      public int getMeterValue(int pos)
      Retrieves the value of the resource amount from the specified meter (e.g., a progress bar).
      Parameters:
      Integer - pos - The position of the meter in the window (1-based index).
      Returns:
      An Integer value of the meter, or 0 if the meter is not found.

    • close

      public boolean close()
      Closes the current window.
      Returns:
      A Boolean value. true if the window was successfully closed, false otherwise.

    • isActual

      public boolean isActual()
      Checks if the window exists.
      Returns:
      A Boolean value. true if the window exists, false otherwise.
